intro: Trichinium manglesii var. angustifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved trichinium, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant features slender, angular stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. Its small white to yellowish flowers bloom in clusters, contributing to its ornamental value. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded to partially sunny environments.
